content:
API Documentation url:
https://console.groq.com/docs/api-reference

Groq

Action
Groq
Analyze Images (Vision)
Analyze the content of an image using a multimodal model to generate human-readable text for providing insights about given visual data

Action
Groq
Create a Chat Completion
Creates a model response for the given chat conversation.

Action
Groq
Create a JSON Chat Completion
Creates a model response for a given chat conversation with JSON response type.

Action
Groq
Create a Transcription (Whisper)
Creates a transcription of audio to text.

Action
Groq
Create a Translation (Whisper)
Translate spoken words in audio or video files to English.

Action
Groq
Make an API Call
Performs an arbitrary authorized API call

Action
Groq
List Models
List all available models

I am planning to build an integration component for groq. Could you provide me with a list and description of the most commonly used and essential API endpoints for this service? Specifically, I am interested in endpoints related to core operations. For each endpoint, please include the HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE), the endpoint URL or path, link to documentation, a brief description of its purpose, provide list of inputs. If possible, also mention any authentication requirements.
Create the service json as well, (serviceJson property)
ignore input parameters for pagination, it could be for example page, offset, limit, etc.

Action naming conventions: Try to avoid naming with "List", such as "List Users", "List Contacts" etc. Use "Find" instead. For example "Find Users", "FInd Contacts". These actions have usually input parameters for search, such as "query", "search" or similar.

Provide information about authentication, include type of authentication, and other properties. Provide information about authentication endpoint URL, token URL for managing access token - for obtaining access token and refreshing access token. Provide information about profile info URL, where is possible to get information about current user. It is used for getting user profile information, such as email, name, etc. (authentication property)
